content:
Diagnosis:	
Bilateral mammary carcinoma, initial left mastectomy with level I/II axillary dissection 2008 followed by chest wall radiotherapy and tamoxifen; subsequent right-sided completion mastectomy 2012.

Initiated anastrozole January 2022 - developed local recurrence
Skin punch biopsy confirms Grade 2 invasive ductal carcinoma, ER 8/8, PR positive, HER2 negative

Breast MDT Discussion

Imaging: PET-CT comparison with January demonstrates increased metabolic activity right anterior chest wall with associated inflammatory changes. No evidence of distant metastatic disease.

MDT recommendation: Consider switch to alternative endocrine therapy with addition of CDK4/6 inhibitor

Seen with [redacted name].

Subjectively noting increased firmness and discomfort of right chest wall with progressive skin changes.
No systemic symptoms.
No other cancer-related concerns.

PMH: Drug-induced hypothyroidism on replacement
Steroid-induced osteoporosis on denosumab
Mild cognitive impairment

Medications: Current anastrozole, levothyroxine, denosumab 6-monthly, calcium/vitamin D supplementation

Social History: Lives in sheltered accommodation
Former teacher
Widowed, daughter lives nearby providing support
Never smoker

Performance Status 1
BP 136/82
Left chest wall shows well-healed mastectomy scar
Right chest wall demonstrates patchy induration with periareolar changes affecting approximately 40% of surface area
No palpable supraclavicular nodes
Chest clear
Regular cardiac rhythm
Soft, non-tender abdomen
No ankle swelling

Discussed disease progression on current endocrine therapy. Explained rationale for changing treatment to exemestane with palbociclib. Patient expressing understanding but requesting time to consider options.

[redacted name] to attend next consultation with family. Written information provided about proposed treatment regimen. Emergency oncology contact details given.
